title: External Packages Should not Need to Match Known Versions

labels.name: concretizer-use-case
labels.description: interesting dependency hierarchy that would challenge the current concretizer

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

Register a version of an external package in your `packages.yaml` that is not known (as `version(...)` line) to the builtin spack recipe. Mark the package as not build-able from source. Install the external version.

### Error Message

This usually results in a silent concretization issue and confusing error message.

In the [CI example here](https://github.com/openPMD/openPMD-api/pull/723), registering an "unknown" perl version it led to the `spack spec adios2@2.5.0%gcc@9.3.0~mpi` output
```
Input spec
--------------------------------
adios2@2.5.0%gcc@9.3.0~mpi

Concretized
--------------------------------

==> Error: No compilers with spec gcc@7.4.0 found for operating system ubuntu18.04 and target x86_64.
```

### Information on your system

Travis CI on Ubuntu 18.04 (and older) with a multi-platform configuration, see https://github.com/openPMD/openPMD-api/pull/723
